title: Fetuli Talanoa
text:
Fetuli Talanoa (born 23 November 1987) is a former <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Tonga</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played as a or . He played for the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in the <a href="NRL">NRL</a> and for <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>. He announced his retirement in April 2019.
Background.
Talanoa was born in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, New Zealand. He is of Tongan ancestry.
Playing career.
Talanoa began his playing career for the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in The NRL and also played for Souths feeder side The <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney Bears</a> in The <a href="NSW%20Cup">NSW Cup</a>. 
With Norths, Talanoa played 38 games and scored 14 tries.
In 2014, Talanoa signed for <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> club <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull FC</a>. In 2016, he would play in Hull's 12-10 win over the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> in the <a href="2016%20Challenge%20Cup">2016 Challenge Cup</a> final. This was the first time that Hull had won the cup at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a> after 8 previous attempts.
In 2017, Hull won the <a href="2017%20Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> again with Talanoa scoring a try in the 18-14 win over the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>.
Talanoa announced his immediate retirement from playing on 9 April 2019 after discovering that a pre-season wrist injury which prevented him from making any appearances for Hull F.C. during the first half of the <a href="Super%20League%20XXIV">2019 Super League season</a> would require further surgery.
International.
Fetuli has appeared on several occasions for the <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Tonga</a> with his first international appearances coming during the 2006 <a href="Federation%20Shield">Federation Shield</a> competition.
In August 2008, Talanoa was named in the <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20squads%23Tonga">Tonga training squad</a> for the <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2008 Rugby League World Cup</a>, and in October 2008 he was named in the final 24-man <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20squads%23Tonga">Tonga</a> squad.
He was named in the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team%232008%20World%20Cup%20Squad">New Zealand training squad</a> for the <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2008 Rugby League World Cup</a>.
